description: Corruption of falbala; first attested in the late 1600s or early 1700s. Not related to fur.

entries.meaning: A frill, flounce, or ruffle, as on clothing; a decorative piece of fabric, especially one gathered or pleated as into a ruffle, etc.
examples: All the other furbelows, and portions of this one[this Medusa] that lay below the expansion, floated as usual through the water, except that on some occasions an accessory power was obtained by pressing a portion of another furbelow to the side of the glass and making it adhere just like the portion that was exposed to the surface of the air.

verbs.description: furbelow (third-person singular simple present furbelows, present participle furbelowing, simple past and past participle furbelowed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To adorn with a furbelow; to ornament.
